alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 11:58AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jewell, southern Nuckolls and southwestern Thayer Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1158 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bostwick to near Hardy. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Hardy, Byron, Webber and Bostwick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
